question: 追悼
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: <kanji>Follow</kanji> people who <kanji>grieve</kanji> by <vocabulary>mourning</vocabulary> with them. You don't want to be the only one who doesn't seem sad.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You learned this reading with the word <ja>追随</ja>, but here's a mnemonic to help you just in case:

You're <vocabulary>mourning</vocabulary> the loss of your pet bird. You can't help but yell <reading>TWEE</reading>T (<ja>つい</ja>) to the sky, hoping she'll come back to life. It doesn't work so you stay in a state of mourning for the rest of your life. She was your best bird friend, after all.
